page.title: 12HARNHAM HILL , SALISBURY
page.content: About 2km long, facing north, with a large chalk pit in the west end.Overlooks Salisbury with views of the{Cathedal,Rivers Avons, Nadder and {Wylye and Old Sarum.}Bishop's Walk plaque: 'This walk and adjacent slope were presented to the Citizens of Sal. by John Wordsworth B. of Sal. 1885 _ 1911'. Mr Rogers of Essex rented the chalkpit from Lord Folkestone to supply whiting works at Quidhampton. Saxon graves excavated 1854, 67 skeletons found. Local beauty spot with fine views and some woodland. New conservation project to preserve wild life and prevent further eyesores like the prominent television transmitter. The fate of the chalkpit is still undecided.
